Pages.Title: Do you agree to the terms and conditions of submitting an application?
Pages.LinkTitle: Do you agree to the terms and conditions of submitting an application?

Validations.Name: Required
Validations.ErrorMessage: Tell us if you agree to the terms and conditions of submitting an application

Pages.BodyText:
These terms and conditions are to ensure apprentices and government funding are protected.

By submitting an application you agree to:

  • all application answers being accurate and specific to your organisation
  • ESFA using information in the public domain to verify the assessment of application answers
  • ESFA using information it already has on your organisation to verify the assessment of application questions
  • tell ESFA if any application answers change
  • tell ESFA if the ownership of your organisation changes
  • cooperate within 5 working days if ESFA makes an enquiry about your organisation or this application

By submitting an application, you understand that:

  • incorrect application answers could lead to civil or criminal proceedings
  • your application may be rejected if there’s evidence of collusion with other apprenticeship training providers or organisations
  • your application may be rejected if your organisation falls under the 'funding higher risk organisations and subcontractors' (or any policy that replaces it)
  • your application may be rejected if there's a change in your application answers which in ESFA's judgement does or may impact on your organisation’s ability to deliver apprenticeship training
  • your application may be rejected if your organisation does not comply with the requirements of the apprenticeship funding rules or performance management rules

    • ESFA may ask for further information on any application answers - they may fail or reject your application if you do not comply within 5 working days of their request.

    ESFA reserve the right to change these terms and conditions at any time. Your organisation is obligated to meet the changes made to these terms and conditions.

    You'll be able to view these terms and conditions and any changes on the RoATP GOV.UK page (opens in a new window or tab).

Pages.Title: Do you agree to the terms and conditions of submitting an application?
Pages.LinkTitle: Do you agree to the terms and conditions of submitting an application?

Validations.Name: Required
Validations.ErrorMessage: Tell us if you agree to the terms and conditions of submitting an application

Pages.BodyText:
These terms and conditions are to ensure government funding and apprentices are protected.

By submitting an application you agree to:

  • all application answers being accurate and specific to your organisation
  • ESFA using information in the public domain to support the assessment of application answers
  • ESFA using information it already has on your organisation to support the assessment of application questions
  • tell ESFA if any application answers change
  • tell ESFA if the ownership of your organisation changes
  • cooperate within 5 working days if ESFA makes an enquiry about your organisation or this application

By submitting an application, you understand that:

  • incorrect application answers could lead to civil or criminal proceedings
  • your application may be rejected if there’s evidence of collusion with other apprenticeship training providers or organisations
  • your application may be rejected if your organisation falls under the 'funding higher risk organisations and subcontractors' (or any policy that replaces it)
  • your application may be rejected if there’s a change in your application answers which in ESFA’s judgement does or may impact on your organisation’s ability to deliver apprenticeship training

ESFA may ask for further information on any application answers - they may fail or reject your application if you do not comply within 5 working days of their request.

ESFA reserve the right to change these terms and conditions at any time. Your organisation is obligated to meet the changes made to these terms and conditions.

You'll be able to view these terms and conditions and any changes on the RoATP GOV.UK page (opens in a new window or tab).

Pages.Title: You do not agree to the terms and conditions of submitting an application
Pages.LinkTitle: You do not agree to the terms and conditions of submitting an application
Pages.BodyText:
This means your organisation cannot apply to join the RoATP.

If you want to change your answer, you can sign back in and submit your application. We will save it for 30 days - after this, we will delete it and you will need to start again.

Back to GOV.UK

Pages.Title: Do you agree to the terms and conditions of joining and staying on the RoATP?
Pages.LinkTitle: Do you agree to the terms and conditions of joining and staying on the RoATP?

Validations.Name: Required
Validations.ErrorMessage: Tell us if you agree to the terms and conditions of joining the RoATP

Pages.BodyText:
These terms and conditions are to ensure apprentices and government funding are protected.

If your application to join the RoATP is successful, your organisation agrees to:

  • implement the policies and processes mentioned in this application
  • directly deliver apprenticeship training within any 12 month period of joining the RoATP - delivering apprenticeship training as a subcontractor does not count
  • follow the funding agreement it will have with ESFA
  • complete all on-boarding tasks - it will not join the RoATP until all on-boarding tasks are complete
    • comply with the requirements of the apprenticeship funding rules or performance management rules

ESFA may ask existing apprenticeship training providers to re-apply to the RoATP. This will be dependant on the rules of joining the RoATP at the time.

Once your organisation joins the RoATP, it may be removed if:

  • it breaches a funding agreement held with ESFA
  • it has an apprenticeship funding agreement terminated by ESFA
  • it has apprenticeship funding withdrawn by ESFA
  • it requests to be withdrawn or terminated from an apprenticeship funding agreement held with ESFA
  • it receives an 'inadequate' Ofsted grade for apprenticeships or overall effectiveness in further education and skills
  • it receives an 'inadequate' financial health grade
  • its ownership or people control control changes and no apprenticeship delivery took place before the change happened
  • it falls under the 'funding higher risk organisations and subcontractors' (or any policy that replaces it)
  • it does not comply with the requirements of the apprenticeship funding rules or performance management rules

ESFA reserve the right to change these terms and conditions at any time. Your organisation is obligated to meet the changes made to these terms and conditions.

You'll be able to view these terms and conditions and any changes on the RoATP GOV.UK page (opens in a new window or tab).

Pages.Title: Do you agree to the terms and conditions of joining the RoATP?
Pages.LinkTitle: Do you agree to the terms and conditions of joining the RoATP?

Validations.Name: Required
Validations.ErrorMessage: Tell us if you agree to the terms and conditions of joining the RoATP

Pages.BodyText:
These terms and conditions are to ensure apprentices and government funding are protected.

If your application to join the RoATP is successful, your organisation agrees to:

  • implement the policies and processes mentioned in this application
  • follow its lead provider's policies and plans if asked by them

ESFA may ask existing apprenticeship training providers to re-apply to the RoATP. This will be dependant on the rules of joining the RoATP at the time.

Once your organisation joins the RoATP, it may be removed if:

  • it breaches a funding agreement held wIth ESFA
  • it breaches an apprenticeship contract held with either a main or employer provider
  • it has an apprenticeship contract terminated by a main or employer provider
  • it receives an 'inadequate' Ofsted grade for apprenticeships or overall effectiveness in further education and skills
  • its ownership or people control control changes and no apprenticeship delivery took place before the change happened
  • it receives an 'inadequate' financial health grade
  • it does not comply with the requirements of the apprenticeship funding rules or performance management rules

ESFA reserve the right to change these terms and conditions at any time. Your organisation is obligated to meet the changes made to these terms and conditions.

You'll be able to view these terms and conditions and any changes on the RoATP GOV.UK page (opens in a new window or tab).

Pages.Title: You do not agree to the terms and conditions of joining the RoATP
Pages.LinkTitle: You do not agree to the terms and conditions of joining the RoATP
Pages.BodyText:
This means your organisation cannot apply to join the RoATP.

If you want to change your answer, you can sign back in and submit your application. We will save it for 30 days - after this, we will delete it and you will need to start again.

Back to GOV.UK
